content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
Consists of:
• A boiler positioned at (8.0, 20.5) that delivers steam via its output at (6.5, 20.5) and features connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5). Its fluid system identifier has recently updated to 57639.
• Multiple steam engines installed at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5) to convert steam into energy.
• An extra steam engine remains unplaced due to persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone.

### Automated Mining Setup
Consists of:
• A burner mining drill, burner inserters and a wooden chest arranged for resource extraction.
• (No updates since the previous report.)

### Smelting Process Cluster
Consists of:
• Stone furnaces accompanied by burner inserters and wooden chests configured to convert raw ores into plates.
• (No updates since the previous report.)

### Fluid and Electrical Infrastructure
Consists of:
• An offshore pump delivering water, several pipe groups forming a fluid distribution network, electricity groups interlinking power poles, and belt groups connecting production zones.
• (No updates since the previous report.)

### Research Lab Network
Consists of:
• Lab units dedicated to automation research and science pack processing, along with associated electrical components.
• (No updates since the previous report; power connectivity issues persist.)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue:
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable because of severe spatial congestion within the boiler zone. Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts—especially around the (8.5, 22.5) connection region—are the primary contributors.
  – Mitigation strategies include removing or repositioning conflicting entities, redesigning adjacent connection interfaces to expand the buildable space, or relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area.

• Steam Engine Network Connection Warnings:
  – Several steam engines report being disconnected from the power network and lacking proper liquid input.
  – Verify that the connection points of each steam engine align accurately with the boiler’s steam output and ensure that both electrical and fluid piping are correctly integrated.

• Research Lab Power Connectivity Issue:
  – Lab units continue to exhibit a NO_POWER status, indicating persistent power network integration problems.
  – Reassess and reconfigure the electrical network layout to ensure lab components are correctly connected to the primary power grid.
